intro: Myrtoleucodendron exaratum, commonly known as the white-leaved myrtle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are typically white or pale green in color. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale pink, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
